DOC.brief_summary: Evaluate safety efficacy ophthalmic intravitreal injection ALG-1001 human subject symptomatic focal vitreomacular adhesion
DOC.brief_title: A Safety And Efficacy Study Of Alg-1001 In Human Subjects With Symptomatic Focal Vitreomacular Adhesion
DOC.criteria: 1 . Symptomatic focal vitreomacular adhesion 2 . Vitreomacular traction syndrome 3 . Stage 1 2 macular hole , ≤ 350 µm 4 . BCVA 20/25 Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study ( ETDRS ) bad study eye 5 . BCVA 20/800 ETDRS good fellow eye 6 . Male female subject , 18 year age old 7 . Signed Informed Consent 1 . High myope > 8.0 D spherical equivalent 2 . History prior vitrectomy study eye 3 . History photocoagulation retina study eye 4 . Macular hole study eye > 350 µm 5 . Subjects epiretinal membrane study eye 6 . Subjects broad VMA , define VMA > 1500 µm 7 . Subjects proliferative Diabetic Retinopathy ( DR ) , neovascular Agerelated Macular Degeneration ( AMD ) , retinal vascular occlusion study eye 8 . Subjects aphakia study eye 9 . Subjects uncontrolled glaucoma 10 . Subjects lenticular zonular instability 11 . Subjects prior ocular surgery intravitreal injection study eye within 90 day study enrollment 12 . Pregnant nursing woman
